name: 'Big' and 'Little' Movies Quiz | Name the Movie | 10 Questions

questions.text: This movie starred River Phoenix who discovers his parents are KGB agents.
questions.explanation:
Little Nikita.

	When Jeff Grant (Phoenix) applies to the Air Force Academy, he finds out the truth about his parents.  Also starring Sidney Poitier as FBI agent Roy Parmenter.

questions.text: This offbeat comedy starred Jeff Bridges as an unemployed "dude" who is mistaken for somebody else.
questions.explanation:
The Big Lebowski.

	This hilarious 1998 movie also co-starred John Goodman and Steve Buscemi as his bowling buddies. Also co-starring Tara Reid, Julianne Moore and Ben Gazzara.

questions.text: This was the last of the Marx Brothers movies to be made for MGM studios.
questions.explanation:
The Big Store.

	In this 1941 comedy, Groucho Marx plays Wolf J. Flywheel a two-bit detective hired by department store owner Martha Phelps (Margaret Dumont) as a bodyguard to her nephew (Tony Martin).

questions.text: This 1980 movie was about a group of 15 year old girls at summer camp.
questions.explanation:
Little Darlings.

	Starring Tatum O'neal and Kristy McNichol this movie focused on who would lose their virginity first.  Also co-starring Armand Assante and  Matt Dillon.

questions.text: This movie chronicles the life of Jack Crabb, a 121 year old survivor of Custer's Last Stand.
questions.explanation:
Little Big Man.

	Dustin Hoffman stars in this 1970 comedy/western as Jack Crabb who was captured and raised by Native Americans. Also co-starring Faye Dunaway and Richard Mulligan.

questions.text: This 1999 movie featured the voices of Michael J. Fox and Nathan Lane.
questions.explanation:
Stuart Little.

	Adapted from the classic E.B. White novel, this movie combined computer animation and live action filming. Also co-starring (live action) Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie and Jonathan Lipnicki.

questions.text: Humphrey Bogart stars as Phillip Marlowe in this 1946 mystery.
questions.explanation:
The Big Sleep.

	Phillip Marlowe (Bogart) is hired by a wealthy General (Charles Waldron) to investigate the blackmailing of his daughter Carmen (Martha Vickers). Also co-starring Lauren Bacall as Carmen's older and protective sister.

questions.text: This 1998 movie was adapted from the Jim Cartwright play about an underdog girl.
questions.explanation:
Little Voice.

	Jane Horrocks portrays Little Voice a shy girl living with her mom (Brenda Blethyn) with an incredible singing voice. Also co-starring Michael Caine and Ewan McGregor.

questions.text: This 1987 movie starred Dennis Quaid as Lieutenant Remy Swain investigating a gangland murder.
questions.explanation:
The Big Easy.

	Set in New Orleans this crime thriller tells the story of Lieutenant Swain and his investigation that eventually leads to the discovery of police corruption.  Also starring Ellen Barkin as District Attorney Ann Osborne who falls in love with Swain.

questions.text: This was Shirley Temple's first Technicolor feature.  It was inspired by a novel from Frances Hodgson Burnett.
questions.explanation:
The Little Princess.

	This 1939 movie starred Temple as a girl sent off to boarding school by her wealthy widowed father (Ian Hunter). Also co-starring Cesar Romero and Arthur Treacher.
